list.title: $share
list.description: Share objects between files / modules (in the engine). By default, variables/etc defined (in the engine) in one file aren't accessible in another. NOTE that shared variables are not automatically updated (copy, not reference).

list.title: AnimationFrame
list.description: An animation frame

list.title: AnimationOptions
list.description: Animation options

list.title: animation
list.description: Animations for use in gameify. Usually you'll access this through the gameify object.

list.title: audio
list.description: Audio for use with gameify. Usually you'll access this through the gameify object.

list.title: camera
list.description: Camera for use in gameify

list.title: docs.getDocs
list.description: Returns the documentation link to a given concept

list.title: gameify
list.description: This is the main gameify object. All other things are contained within it.

list.title: gameify.Animation#applyFrameTo
list.description: Apply an animation frame to an object

list.title: gameify.Animation#applyTo
list.description: Apply an animation frame to an object

list.title: gameify.Animation#frames
list.description: The frames of the animation

list.title: gameify.Animation#framesFromJSON
list.description: Creates frames from their JSON representation

list.title: gameify.Animation#framesToJSON
list.description: Converts this animation's frames to JSON

list.title: gameify.Animation#fromJSON
list.description: Creates a object from JSON data

list.title: gameify.Animation#getFrameAt
list.description: Get the frame at the given time

list.title: gameify.Animation#getFrameNumberAt
list.description: Get the frame number at the given time

list.title: gameify.Animation#isAfterCompletion
list.description: Check if a the animation is completed after a specific time If options.loop is true, always returns false

list.title: gameify.Animation#options
list.description: The animation's options

list.title: gameify.Animation#setFrames
list.description: Update the animation's frames

list.title: gameify.Animation#toJSON
list.description: Convert the object to JSON

list.title: gameify.Animation.propertyTypes
list.description: Animation types. Most types replace the value (absolute)

list.title: gameify.Animation.propertyTypes.Image
list.description: A gameify.Image (on a sprite, or other object with a setImage method)

list.title: gameify.Animation.propertyTypes.Vector2d
list.description: A gameify.Vector2d

list.title: gameify.Animation.propertyTypes.boolean
list.description: A boolean

list.title: gameify.Animation.propertyTypes.number
list.description: A number

list.title: gameify.Animation.propertyTypes.object
list.description: Apply the property using Object.apply() each frame

list.title: gameify.Animation.propertyTypes.simple
list.description: Apply the property by overwriting the old value each frame

list.title: gameify.Animation.propertyTypes.string
list.description: A string

list.title: gameify.Animator#animationProgress
list.description: The time the animation started playing

list.title: gameify.Animator#animations
list.description: The animations currently assigned to the animator. Use Animator.set() and Animator.play() to add and play animations

list.title: gameify.Animator#currentAnimation
list.description: The animation that is currently playing (or undefined if not playing). Use Animator.play() to change the current animation being played.

list.title: gameify.Animator#fromJSON
list.description: Creates a object from JSON data

list.title: gameify.Animator#parent
list.description: The object that this animator is attached to

list.title: gameify.Animator#pause
list.description: Pause the animation

list.title: gameify.Animator#play
list.description: Play an animation

list.title: gameify.Animator#playing
list.description: If an animation is currently playing

list.title: gameify.Animator#resume
list.description: Resume the animation

list.title: gameify.Animator#set
list.description: Add an animation to the animations list

list.title: gameify.Animator#stop
list.description: Stop & reset the animation

list.title: gameify.Animator#toJSON
list.description: Convert the object to JSON

list.title: gameify.Animator#update
list.description: Update the animation

list.title: gameify.Camera#focus
list.description: Position the center of the screen (using absolute position). Useful for following a player/sprite

list.title: gameify.Camera#focus
list.description: Position the center of the screen (using absolute position). Useful for following a player/sprite

list.title: gameify.Camera#maxDistance
list.description: The maximum distance the camera can be from its target position, in pixels. If the camera goes too far away, it will speed up to stay close to the target. (Note, this distance is measured as a square, not a circle)

list.title: gameify.Camera#minDistance
list.description: The minimum distance the camera must be from its target position, in pixels, before the camera starts to move. (Note, this distance is measured as a square, not a circle)

list.title: gameify.Camera#resetTransform
list.description: Reset the camera's (canvas's) transformation

list.title: gameify.Camera#setDrawMode
list.description: Sets the camera draw mode. Set to 'ui' mode before drawing UI elements, set to 'world' for drawing everything else. (draw mode is reset to 'world' each frame). Equivalent to calling camera.resetTransform() or camera.update(0)

list.title: gameify.Camera#setSpeed
list.description: Set the translation speed of the camera. 1 is instant, 0 is stationary.

list.title: gameify.Camera#translate
list.description: Translate the camera (relative to the current transform)

list.title: gameify.Camera#translate
list.description: Translate the camera (relative to the current transform)

list.title: gameify.Camera#translateAbsolute
list.description: Translate the camera (using absolute positioning)

list.title: gameify.Camera#translateAbsolute
list.description: Translate the camera (using absolute positioning)

list.title: gameify.Camera#translationSpeed
list.description: The translation speed of the camera. 1 is instant, 0 is stationary.

list.title: gameify.Camera#update
list.description: Update the camera. If you're using the a gameify.Screen's camera, this will be called automatically. This function rounds translation vectors to whole numbers for better rendering

list.title: gameify.Image#changePath
list.description: Change and load a new image path. Reset's the image's crop

list.title: gameify.Image#crop
list.description: Crop the image

list.title: gameify.Image#draw
list.description: Draw the image to a context

list.title: gameify.Image#fromJSON
list.description: Creates a object from JSON data

list.title: gameify.Image#getCrop
list.description: Get the image crop. Returns an object with x, y, width, and height properties.

list.title: gameify.Image#loaded
list.description: If the image is loaded

list.title: gameify.Image#onLoad
list.description: Set a function to be run when the image is loaded

list.title: gameify.Image#path
list.description: The image filepath. Modifying this will not do anything.

list.title: gameify.Image#tileData
list.description: If the image was derived from a tileset, details about where it came from. Mostly used for serialization. See example below for schema.

list.title: gameify.Image#toJSON
list.description: Convert the object to JSON

list.title: gameify.Image#uncrop
list.description: Remove crop from the image

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager
list.description: Manages keyboard events. One is created automatically for every screen, you can access it as shown in the example.

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager#destruct
list.description: Destructs the event manager (clears events)

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager#keyIsPressed
list.description: Check if a key is currently pressed down

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager#keyWasJustPressed
list.description: Check if a key was just pressed and let up

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager#makeKeyNicer
list.description: Makes pressed keys nicer, for simpler queries (KeyH --> H)

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager#onFirstFocus
list.description: Run a callback when the game is first focused (Useful for starting audio, etc)

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager#setCaptureScope
list.description: Changes the scope that the KeyboardInputManager looks at

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager#setJustPressedTimeout
list.description: Sets how long before "just pressed" keys are removed from the just pressed list. By default, keys are removed from the list after one frame.

list.title: gameify.KeyboardEventManager#setup
list.description: Sets up the event manager.

list.title: gameify.MouseEventManager
list.description: Manages mouse events. One is created automatically for every screen, you can access it as shown in the example.

list.title: gameify.MouseEventManager#buttonIsPressed
list.description: Check if a button is currently pressed down

list.title: gameify.MouseEventManager#destruct
list.description: Destructs the event manager (clears events)

list.title: gameify.MouseEventManager#eventJustHappened
list.description: Check if a mouse event just happened (eg a button press or scroll)

list.title: gameify.MouseEventManager#getPosition
list.description: Get the x and y position of the mouse cursor

list.title: gameify.MouseEventManager#setCaptureScope
list.description: Changes the scope that the KeyboardInputManager looks at

list.title: gameify.MouseEventManager#setRecentEventTimeout
list.description: Sets how long before "just pressed" keys are removed from the just pressed list. By default, keys are removed from the list after one frame.

list.title: gameify.MouseEventManager#setup
list.description: Sets up the event manager.

list.title: gameify.Scene#draw
list.description: Draw the scene. This is done automatically, you usually shouldn't have to use it yourself.

list.title: gameify.Scene#fromJSON
list.description: Creates a object from JSON data

list.title: gameify.Scene#lock
list.description: Lock the scene, meaning you cannot switch to another scene until it is unlocked with scene.unlock()

list.title: gameify.Scene#locked
list.description: If the scene is locked

list.title: gameify.Scene#onDraw
list.description: Set the draw function for this scene

list.title: gameify.Scene#onLoad
list.description: Run when the scene is set as a Screen's active scene

list.title: gameify.Scene#onUnload
list.description: Run when the scene is set as inactive / replaced by another scene

list.title: gameify.Scene#onUpdate
list.description: Set the update function for this scene

list.title: gameify.Scene#parent
list.description: The parent Screen

list.title: gameify.Scene#toJSON
list.description: Convert the object to JSON

list.title: gameify.Scene#unlock
list.description: Unlock the scene, meaning you can now switch to another scene. Scenes are unlocked by default

list.title: gameify.Scene#update
list.description: Update the scene

list.title: gameify.Screen#add
list.description: Add a Sprite to the Screen. This makes it so that sprite.draw(); draws to this screen.

list.title: gameify.Screen#audio
list.description: This screen's default AudioManager.

list.title: gameify.Screen#camera
list.description: This screen's default Camera.

list.title: gameify.Screen#clear
list.description: Clear the screen

list.title: gameify.Screen#context
list.description: The Canvas Context

list.title: gameify.Screen#currentScene
list.description: The current game scene

list.title: gameify.Screen#element
list.description: The HTML5 Canvas element the Screen is attached to

list.title: gameify.Screen#fromJSON
list.description: Creates a object from JSON data

list.title: gameify.Screen#getAntialiasing
list.description: Check if antialising is enabled (Note, also checks and corrects if the canvas element has the correct antialiasing setting)

list.title: gameify.Screen#getContext
list.description: Get the screen's HTML5 canvas context

list.title: gameify.Screen#getScene
list.description: Returns the game's active scene

list.title: gameify.Screen#getSize
list.description: Get the width and height of the screen

list.title: gameify.Screen#height
list.description: The height of the Screen

list.title: gameify.Screen#keyboard
list.description: Keyboard events for the Screen. Used to see what keys are pressed.

list.title: gameify.Screen#mouse
list.description: Mouse events for the Screen. Used to what mouse buttons are pressed, and other mouse events (eg scroll)

list.title: gameify.Screen#setAntialiasing
list.description: Turn antialiasing on or off (set to off for pixel art)

list.title: gameify.Screen#setHeight
list.description: Changes the height of the Screen

list.title: gameify.Screen#setScene
list.description: Sets the game's scene

list.title: gameify.Screen#setSize
list.description: Changes the size of the Screen

list.title: gameify.Screen#setSize
list.description: Changes the size of the Screen

list.title: gameify.Screen#setSmoothImages
list.description: Alias for setAntialiasing

list.title: gameify.Screen#setWidth
list.description: Changes the width of the Screen

list.title: gameify.Screen#startGame
list.description: Starts the game.

list.title: gameify.Screen#stopGame
list.description: Stops (pauses) the game

list.title: gameify.Screen#toJSON
list.description: Convert the object to JSON

list.title: gameify.Screen#updateInterval
list.description: The game's update interval

list.title: gameify.Screen#width
list.description: The width of the Screen

list.description: The animator for this sprite.

list.description: Have the sprite rotate to face towards a point

list.title: gameify.Sprite#getParent

list.title: gameify.Sprite#goTowards

list.title: gameify.Sprite#image

list.title: gameify.Sprite#onDraw
list.description: Set the draw function for this sprite

list.title: gameify.Sprite#onUpdate
list.description: Run a function when this sprite updates

list.title: gameify.Sprite#parent
list.description: The parent screen (not used directly)

list.title: gameify.Sprite#position
list.description: The position of the Sprite on the screen

list.title: gameify.Sprite#rotation
list.description: The sprite's rotation, in degrees

list.title: gameify.Sprite#scale
list.description: The scale of the sprite's texture

list.title: gameify.Sprite#setContext
list.description: Set the Canvas context to draw to. This should be called whenever a sprite is added to a Screen

list.title: gameify.Sprite#setImage
list.description: Change the Sprite's image / texture

list.title: gameify.Sprite#setShape
list.description: Set a shape for collisions

list.title: gameify.Sprite#setShape

list.title: gameify.Sprite#shape
list.description: The sprite's shape, for collision, etc.

list.title: gameify.Sprite#shapeOffset
list.description: The sprite's shape offset (to align it properly)

list.description: Convert the object to JSON

list.title: gameify.Sprite#update
list.description: Update the Sprite

list.description: The velocity of the Sprite

list.description: Text style data

list.description: The tile's position in the tilemap

list.description: The tile's source coordinates

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#clear
list.description: Clear the tilemap. Removes all placed tiles and cached images

list.description: The Canvas context to draw to

list.description: Draw the tilemap to the screen

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#enableMapBuilder
list.description:
Deprecated. Use the engine editor to build your tilemaps. This editor is no longer maintained.
Enable the map builder tool. This allows you to easily edit tilesets.
Controls are: Click to place, Right-click to delete, Middle-click to pick, Scroll and Ctrl+Scroll to switch tile, Shift+Scroll to rotate the tile.
Once you're finished, call tilemap.exportMapData() to export the map.

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#exportMapData
list.description: Export this tilemap's map data and layout (load with loadMapData)

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#fromJSON
list.description: Creates a Tilemap from JSON data

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#get
list.description: Get the tile (if it exists) placed at a certain position

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#getParent
list.description: Get the screen this sprite draws

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#getTileset
list.description: Get the tilemap's tileset

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#listTiles
list.description: Get an array of all the tiles in the map

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#loadMapData
list.description: Load saved map data (export using exportMapData)

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#mapToScreen
list.description: Convert map coordinates to screen coordinates

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#mapToScreen
list.description: Convert map coordinates to screen coordinates

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#offset
list.description: The tile offset (coordinates of tile <0, 0>). Used to translate the map

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#onDraw
list.description: Set the draw function for this tilemap

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#parent
list.description: The parent screen (not used directly)

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#place
list.description: Place a tile on the tilemap

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#remove
list.description: Remove a tile from the tilemap

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#screenToMap
list.description: Convert screen coordinates to map coordinates

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#screenToMap
list.description: Convert screen coordinates to map coordinates

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#setContext
list.description: Set the Canvas context to draw to. Should be called by a screen when the Tilemap is added to it.

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#setTileset
list.description: What tileset to use. This tileset must include anything you want to use in this tilemap.

list.title: gameify.Tilemap#toJSON
list.description: Convert the Tilemap to JSON

list.title: gameify.Tileset#changePath
list.description: Change and load a new image path. Please note this does not clear tilemaps' cached data, and it might retain its the original image.

list.title: gameify.Tileset#fromJSON
list.description: Creates a object from JSON data

list.title: gameify.Tileset#getTile
list.description: Get a tile (or section of tiles) from the tileset. Returns a new Image object each time, so if you're getting the same tile a lot you might want to save it to a variable

list.title: gameify.Tileset#onLoad
list.description: Set a function to be run when the image is loaded

list.title: gameify.Tileset#texture
list.description: The tileset's image/texture

list.title: gameify.Tileset#toJSON
list.description: Convert the object to JSON

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#add
list.description: Adds this vector and another one

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#copy
list.description: Returns a copy of the vector

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#distanceTo
list.description: Calculate the distance between a this and another vector (From this vector's coordinates to the other vector's coordinates)

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#distanceTo
list.description: Calculate the distance between a this and a line segment (From this vector's coordinates to the closest point on the line segment)

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#getDistance
list.description: Returns the length (magnitude) of the vector. Equivalent to vector.getMagnitude

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#getMagnitude
list.description: Returns the (magnitude) length of the vector. Equivalent to vector.getDistance

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#getNormalized
list.description: Returns a normalized copy of the vector (Sets the length equal to one while maintaining the direction)

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#linearInterpolate
list.description: Linear interpolation from this vector to another

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#multiply
list.description: Multiplies this vector by an amount

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#normalize
list.description: Normalizes the vector (Sets the length equal to one while maintaining the direction)

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#rotated
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector rotated by an angle, in radians (counterclockwise)

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#rotatedDegrees
list.description: Returns a copy of this vector rotated by an angle, in degrees (counterclockwise)

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#rounded
list.description: Returns a copy of the vector with both coordinates to the nearest integer

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#subtract
list.description: Subtracts this vector and another one

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#toJSON
list.description: Returns a JSON representation of the vector

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#toRawString
list.description: Same as toString, but does not truncate the string.

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#toString
list.description: Returns a string representing the vector in the form "<x, y>". Truncated to three decimal places.

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#truncated
list.description: Truncates the x and y values to a certain precision

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#valueOf
list.description: Returns a string representation of the vector, equivalent to toString

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#x
list.description: The x (a) point of the vector

list.title: gameify.Vector2d#y
list.description: The y (b) point of the vector

list.title: gameify.audio.AudioManager
list.description: An audio manager. Controlls multiple sounds at once. Screen objects come with an AudioManager (Screen.audio), but you can create your own for more fine-grained control. This allows you to easily control the volume of different parts of your game independently, i.e. seperate SFX, menu, and gameplay sound sliders.

list.title: gameify.audio.AudioManager#add
list.description: Add a sound to the AudioManager

list.title: gameify.audio.AudioManager#getVolume
list.description: Get the volume of the AudioManager. Note that this volume is mixed with the volume of each sound. Use Sound.getCalculatedVolume to get the actual volume of each sound.

list.title: gameify.audio.AudioManager#setVolume
list.description: Adjust the volume of all controlled sounds

list.title: gameify.audio.AudioManager#sounds
list.description: Sounds this AudioManager controlls. Don't modify this - Use add() and remove() to add/remove sounds. AudioManagers are set to 20% volume by default, to protect your ears.

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#changePath
list.description: Change and load a new image path. Resets the image's crop

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#fromJSON
list.description: Creates a object from JSON data

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#getCalculatedVolume
list.description: Get the calculated volume of the sound (after audioManager volume is applied)

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#getCurrentTime
list.description: Get the current seek time of the sound

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#getDuration
list.description: Get the duration of the audio (in seconds)

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#getLoop
list.description: Check if the sound is set to loop

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#getVolume
list.description: Get the volume of the sound. Note that this volume is mixed with the audioManager's volume to get the actual volume. Use getCalculatedVolume() to get the actual volume the sound will be played at.

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#loaded
list.description: If the sound has loaded yet

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#onLoad
list.description: Set a function to be run when the sound is loaded (Can be played through w/o buffering)

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#path
list.description: The sound path. Modifying this will not do anything.

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#pause
list.description: Pause the sound

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#play
list.description: Play the sound. Please be aware some browsers block autoplay by default.

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#seek
list.description: Seek to a specific point in the audio

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#seekRelative
list.description: Seek a percentage of the way through the audio

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#setLoop
list.description: Choose whether the sound should loop or not (default is not looping)

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#setVolume
list.description: Sets the volume of the sound

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#stop
list.description: Stop the sound (resets the seek time)

list.title: gameify.audio.Sound#toJSON
list.description: Convert the object to JSON

list.title: gameify.shapes.Circle#radius

list.title: gameify.shapes.Rectangle#draw
list.description: Draw the shape to a given context

list.title: gameify.shapes.Rectangle#size
list.description: The size (width and height) of the rectangle

list.title: gameify.shapes.Shape
list.description: A generic shape. The base for all other shapes.

list.title: gameify.shapes.Shape#collidesWith
list.description: Check if this shape collides with another shape

list.title: gameify.shapes.Shape#contains
list.description: Check if a point (Vector2d) is inside this shape

list.title: gameify.shapes.Shape#draw
list.description: Draw a hitbox for debugging

list.title: gameify.shapes.Shape#fillColor
list.description: The fill color when this shape is drawn

list.title: gameify.shapes.Shape#position
list.description: The position of the shape, often locked to the position of a sprite that it represents

list.title: gameify.shapes.Shape#type
list.description: A string represeting the type of shape, eg "Circle"

list.title: gameify.vectors
list.description: Vector helpers

list.title: gameify.vectors.ZERO
list.description: A zero vector for reference and calculation

list.title: gameify.vectors.i
list.description: The i vector <1, 0> for reference and calculation

list.title: gameify.vectors.isCompatibleVector
list.description: Checks if a vector is compatible with operations in this one

list.title: gameify.vectors.j
list.description: The j vector <0, 1> for reference and calculation

list.title: gameify.vectors.longestOf
list.description: Given two vectors, returns the one with the greatest magnitude (length)

list.title: gameify.vectors.shortestOf
list.description: Given two vectors, returns the one with the least magnitude (length)

list.title: images
list.description: Image class for use in gameify. Usually you'll access this through the gameify object.

list.title: inputEventsTables
list.description: This is a mostly complete list of mouse and keyboard input events supported by gameify. Most event names are case-sensitive

list.title: scenes
list.description: Scene class for use in gameify. Usually you'll access this through the gameify object.

list.title: shapes
list.description: Shapes and collision detection for use in gameify. Usually you'll access this through the gameify object.

list.title: sprites
list.description: Sprite class for use in gameify. Usually you'll access this through the gameify object.

list.title: text
list.description: Text for use in gameify. Usually you'll access these through the gameify object.

list.title: ui
list.description: User interfaces elements for use in Gameify

list.title: ui.Button
list.description: A clickable button

list.title: vectors
list.description: Vectors for use in gameify. Usually you'll access these through the gameify object.
